well, both, maybe more with ftp
so you'll have to install a FTP server on one of the computers, I suggest installing "gadmin-proftpd"
now run it from "Applications->System tools"
on the "Servers" tab, you should have a Default server in the list
yes, that's normal, select it and scroll down until you find "Upload speed"
Set both "upload speed" and "download speed" to max values
just enter "10000000000", and it'll set to max when you leave the box
click "apply" and switch to "Users" tab
now you're going to create a new user : fill the username, password and group fields (the user can be an already existing one of the system)
then click "New user"
at the bottom, you should have a "Add directory" button
click on it and select the folder you would like to use as home for your ftp user
check the checkboxes you want to give appropriate permissions (you may check them all)
then click "New user" again
ok, we're done here, click "Activate" in the top toolbar
now from the other computer, run gFTP (from Applications->Internet)
and you'll be able to transfer files between the two computers
